comments:
This class is an introduction to classic Chinese literature, from the 14th to 19th centuries. Students will study various literary forms that emerged from this period as well as read several important works from that era. Novels include Journey to the West, Dream of the Red Chamber and The Plum in the Golden Vase.
Students found the course stimulating and for one student it even became a “constant topic of conversation” with peers and family. The class was described as an “academic journey from ancient to present.” Students warned that a lot of work was required for the class, including readings, several papers, oral reports, and two exams.
Students found Professor Mair to be one of the “best” and “most interesting” professors they have had at Penn. He was described as very knowledgeable about not only Chinese literature but also cultural and contemporary issues.
The course was highly recommended for even those who have no prior Chinese language skills or background. Students believed that they gained a greater interest in East Asian literature.
